review_text:
Our family was in the area for a reunion the first weekend in November and wanted a house that had multiple bedrooms/bathrooms so some of us could stay together instead of booking separate hotel rooms.
The location was close to the reunion location and had 4 bedrooms and a full kitchen which allowed us to make breakfast together and prep food to take to the reunion. Having only a bath and a half was a concession for us, but we managed. The half bath is incredibly small and is located in one of the bedrooms off the hall, but we were thankful to have it with a full house of people. We are a close family so it worked out okay to share it.
We all thought the "bee" theme was so cute! They've done a nice job decorating and making this older house feel homey. Everything was clean. ğŸ™‚Although we saw that some of the dishes still had tags on them, and we didn't really want to take time to wash them before using. There is not a dishwasher. Dish soap, sponges and towels were provided.
Unfortunately, the AC wasn't working for us during our stay. The weather was warm and humid and the temperature in the house got up to 80 degrees overnight. Communication with the owner was excellent! She was very responsive and had her husband go and take a look on Saturday. It was most likely low on Freon and they weren't able to get a repair company out to fix it until Monday, after we left. She was very apologetic and gave us a 10% refund for our inconvenience.
The beds were comfortable and having ceiling fans helped with the AC issue. The 3 bedrooms off the hall are very small, with not much extra space, but the closets could be used for luggage.
The kitchen was in good working order with a full size fridge/freezer, stove, microwave, toaster, as well as a Keurig and drip coffee maker. She provided coffee filters, some coffee and little creamers, which was very nice. It would have have been helpful to have some measuring spoons and cups, a couple of mixing bowls and a non-stick pan. After my suggestion she said she would add them.
There are steps inside the house to access the bedroom off the kitchen (probably used to be a carport/garage). This was important to us as we had a special needs child in a wheelchair. We managed, but that room was the best room for him, because he had to sleep on the floor (since he didn't have a bed with rails like at home) and it was the only bedroom with enough floor space. He's an 80 pound 5 year old, which is a lot to lift! ğŸ˜Š There is an exterior door in that room, which was nice to be able to roll his wheelchair in, without having to go up and down the front steps.
The guys had fun watching football on the big tv!
There were a few things we noticed that might be an issue - in the bedroom with the half bath there is a wire sticking out of the wall outlet and a cable poking up out of the floor.
The caulking around the tub/shower doesn't seem to be sufficient and the shower head is very low. That's fine for us short people, but was a little challenging for the tall ones. But, we really appreciated having plenty of hot water for showers and washing dishes.
Despite a few issues, we enjoyed our time in Vidalia in this cute house and were so thankful to be able to stay together. We wish you all the best!

review_text:
Mel was very responsive, checked on us by text during the rental, and was easy to work with. The instructions for the stay were clear, and the check out procedure was simple, logical and also clear.
The property is easy to find, and convenient to everything. There was plenty of perfectly acceptable parking off the street. When we arrived, the house was sparkling clean, no dust, no dirt, and a faint smell of bleach, which I personally like, but those of you with sensitivities should contact the host.
My group of 5 changed to 3 then expanded to 6 after we arrived, and the host accommodated the changes without any problems. We were very comfortable in the amount of space the home offers, and I was especially glad I could offer the space to the family--their reservations got messed up...and mine didn't.
The living room space is so wonderful that families and friends will want to gather. The furniture is modern and clean and the decorations not overbearing so that you can still use the coffee table and the end tables as tables, with some holiday appropriate touches, which was nice. The climate control worked well, and everybody stayed very comfortable with the temperature in the house.
Every bedroom has a TV, everybody was happy. The rooms are generously sized, each with a window. The beds were comfortable and the white sheets and blankets clean. The beds have fluffy clean white comforters.
A single bath made us anxious on occasion, and the kitchen cookware would not support cooking for 6, but there is a generous list in the welcome book of choices for take out and eating out just beyond the driveway. The amenities for bathroom and coffee service were lush. There is a Keurig and a nice selection of coffee, tea and hot chocolate. The bathroom reminded me of a hotel, with some items offered in case you forgot or in case you flew in and couldn't bring everything with you. There is a shower dispenser with your basics, some tooth brushes and tooth paste, and plenty of fresh white towels and wash cloths. Again, very clean.
Thanks again, Mel. We appreciate your obvious extra efforts during COVID and give you 5 stars. We would definitely choose your home for a repeat stay.
